intro: Peperomia arbuscula, commonly known as the tree peperomia, is a compact, shrub-like plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It features dense, dark green foliage with a velvety texture and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a branching structure that resembles a tree, hence its common name, and it thrives in bright, indirect light. It is relatively low maintenance, requiring well-draining soil and moderate watering. Peperomia arbuscula is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to indoor conditions.
